Title: Terminal operator, NCS fast-track B’Odogwu migration for cargo clearance
Summary: APM Terminals deepens partnership with Nigeria Customs Service to accelerate migration to the B’Odogwu platform at the Lagos Port Complex, Apapa, to enhance trade facilitation and optimise cargo clearance processes . Terminal operator, NCS fast-track migration for cargo clearance .

Title: Gains in 52 stocks push up  capitalisation by N458 billion
Summary: Gains in 52 stocks push up capitalisation by N458 billion . BUA Cement Plc and 51 stocks lifted the overall capitalisation up by N 458 billion . The equities market, yesterday, sustained rising trend .

Title: Coastal Guard condemns arrest of members by Navy
Summary: The Nigerian Coast Guard has condemned the recent arrest of its members in Akwa Ibom State . The Coast Guard described the action as a violation of their rights .

Title: Nigeria lags behind exclusive breastfeeding targets
Summary: The United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) stressed the need to strengthen government and community support to safeguard the well-being of nursing mothers facing severe challenges due to conflict and displacement .

Title: Nigeria’s top energy leaders set for 2025 gas investment forum
Summary: 2025 edition of the Gas Investment Forum (GIF) is set to convene some of the most influential voices in the global and regional energy . Nigeria intensifies efforts to harness its vast natural gas reserves for industrialisation .

Title: States vs DISCOs: Commissioners accuse EEDC of reducing power supply in Enugu
Summary: Forum for Commissioners of Power and Energy in Nigeria, FOCPEN, condemned the ongoing power outages in Enugu State . EEDC based its decision on the recent tariff order issued to its customers in the state .

Title: Doyin Abiola, former Concord MD and MKO’s wife, dies at 82
Summary: Dr. Doyin Abiola died at 9:15 p.m. on Tuesday following a period of illness, according to family sources . She was the wife of the late Chief MKO Abiola . Dr. Abiola was the former Managing Director of National Concord .

Title: ‘Don’t insult us with toilet project,’ Akwa Ibom communities tell Eno
Summary: Esit Eket is being offered toilets as “dividends of democracy'" "Other LGs are getting infrastructure, investments and development initiatives," he said . "Don't insult us with toilet project,’ Akwa Ibom communities tell Eno .

Title: Iran executes man convicted of spying for Israel
Summary: Iranian authorities executed a man convicted of spying for Israel by passing information about a nuclear scientist killed during the 12-day war with Israel in June . Iran executed the man on Wednesday .

Title: Anambra threatens crackdown on parties violating N50m campaign fee rule
Summary: Anambra State Signage and Advertisement Agency has intensified its crackdown on political parties yet to comply with the mandatory N50 million campaign permit fee . The fee, imposed by ANSAA, grants political parties the right to erect billboards, posters, brand vehicles, hoist banners, and engage in other outdoor campaign activities .

Title: Son Heung-min set for record $26m move to LAFC in MLS
Summary: South Korean star, Son Heung-min, has not even been officially announced as joining Los Angeles FC of MLS, but excited fans are already waiting to welcome him . ESPN and The Athletic report that Son, who left Tottenham Hotspur last weekend, will sign with LAFC for an MLS-record transfer fee of $26 million .

Title: Iran executes man convicted of spying for Israel
Summary: Roozbeh Vadi was convicted of spying for Israel by passing information about a nuclear scientist killed during the 12-day war with Israel in June . Vadi transferred “classified information” after he was recruited online by Israel’s spy agency, Mossad . It was not immediately clear when he was arrested or sentenced

Title: South Korean prosecutors question ex-first lady accused of graft
Summary: South Korean prosecutors questioned former first lady Kim Keon Hee on Wednesday over a litany of allegations, including stock manipulation and bribery . She is accused of colluding with traders to inflate the share price of a company between 2009 and 2012 . She also allegedly accepted luxury gifts, including a $2,200 designer handbag, in

Title: APC, Adeleke trade words over gov’s ‘two-week’ absence
Summary: The All Progressives Congress in Osun State accused Governor Ademola Adeleke of abandoning his duties and disappearing from the state for over two weeks .
